numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a trend.
2. Younger generations are more optimistic than older generations.
3. Younger generations think that their generations are getting better.
4. In Morocco, older people are more optimistic than young people.
5. In Nigeria, older people are more optimistic than young people.
6. In India, older people are more optimistic than young people.
7. I wonder about Indonesia.
8. In Indonesia, young people are more optimistic than people in Nigeria.
9. In Indonesia, young people are more optimistic than people in India.
10. I wonder about Zimbabwe.
11. In Zimbabwe, young people are more optimistic than people in Nigeria.
12. In Zimbabwe, young people are more optimistic than people in India.
13. Young people in Indonesia are relatively optimistic.
14. Young people in Zimbabwe are relatively optimistic.
15. Older people in Indonesia are less optimistic than young people in Indonesia.
16. Older people in Zimbabwe are less optimistic than young people in Zimbabwe.
17. I fit this demographic.
18. I am 16 years old.
19. I am from the US.
20. I believe that the world gets better as generations go by.
21. My beliefs were not surveyed.
22. However, I still apply to this demographic.
23. The title is: Youthful optimism: how a country's youths see the future.
